definition: used in place names, notably Kunlun Mountains 崑崙|昆仑[Kun1 lun2]/(also used for transliteration)
descendant/elder brother/a style of Chinese poetry
cavity of body/barrel (e.g. engine cylinder)/compartment/tune/accent of speech

sentences.english: Kunqu is one of the several operatic tunes developed very quickly in the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 昆腔是几大戏曲声腔之一，在明代发展很快。

definition: a general term for local operas in Shangxi, Henan, Hebei, Shandong etc/the music of such operas
variant of 二黃|二黄[er4 huang2]
Kunqu opera, influential musical theater originating in Kunshan, Jiangsu province in Yuan times
ballad tune in southern dialects, usually to sanxian 三弦 or pipa 琵琶 accompaniment
local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
